  display: block;
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
  margin: 20px auto;
  border-radius: 8px;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
}
img:hover {
  transform: scale(1.02);
  transition: transform 0.3s ease;
}

.center-text {
  text-align: center;
}

## Auckland Weather

```{r}
print(plot_condition)

summary_stats <- latest_data %>%
  summarise(
    observations = n(),
    avg_temp = mean(temp, na.rm = TRUE) %>% round(1),
    min_temp = min(temp, na.rm = TRUE),
    max_temp = max(temp, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_humidity = mean(humidity, na.rm = TRUE) %>% round(1),
    na_humidity = sum(is.na(humidity))
  )

best_weather <- latest_data %>%
  filter(condition == "Sunny") %>%
  summarise(best_weather = n())


```


The dataset contains `r summary_stats$observations` observations.

The average temperature is `r summary_stats$avg_temp`°C, with a minimum of `r summary_stats$min_temp`°C and a maximum of `r summary_stats$max_temp`°C.

The average humidity is `r summary_stats$avg_humidity`%, with `r summary_stats$na_humidity` missing humidity records.

The BEST weather to have is `r best_weather$best_weather` sunny days in March!

Also, it has many `r best_weather$best_weather` sunny days during the month.
